thread.title: Pocono Sports Roundup: Meisse sisters lead Mounties to 7-0 win
thread.title_full: Pocono Sports Roundup: Meisse sisters lead Mounties to 7-0 win

author: Staff reports
title: Pocono Sports Roundup: Meisse sisters lead Mounties to 7-0 win
text: Girls volleyball Saucon Valley 3, PM East 0 SWIFTWATER - Pocono Mountain East fell 25-12, 25-19 and 25-15 to Saucon Valley in non-conference girls volleyball on Saturday. College field hockey No. 3 ESU 2, Mercyhurst 1 (OT) EAST STROUDSBURG - Junior midfielder Desiraye Mack scored the game’s first goal and assisted on the game-winner by senior forward Ally Roth 1:08 into overtime, giving No. 3-ranked East Stroudsburg University a 2-1 (OT) win over Mercyhurst on Saturday afternoon at Whitenight Field. Mack scored 24:11 into the contest, and ESU held a 1-0 lead for the next 25 minutes until Emily Koestler tied the game at 1-1 with 21:27 remaining in regulation. Roth scored on the first shot of overtime, knocking in a pass from Mack to lift the Warriors to 8-2 (3-0 PSAC). ESU had a 22-6 advantage in shots and 9-2 edge in shots on goal. Sam Takac made seven saves for Mercyhurst (3-7, 1-3) and junior goalkeeper Danielle Ard had one save for ESU. Roth’s goal was the 60th of her career, extending her school record. Roth and Mack both have seven goals this season, tied for the team lead. ESU has allowed just seven goals through its first 10 games and hasn’t allowed more than one goal in any game. The Warriors posted their second OT win of the season, also winning 2-1 (OT) at Slippery Rock on September 19. Women's volleyball ESU 3, Cheyney 0 EAST STROUDSBURG - Freshman outside hitter Jineane Hallaj had eight kills and freshman Tina Predojevic had five kills, 11 digs and 22 assists to lead East Stroudsburg University to a 3-0 win vs. Cheyney in PSAC East women’s volleyball on Saturday at Koehler Fieldhouse. Freshman middle blocker Monica Sheaffer had six kills and senior middle blocker Megan Braunagel added five kills for ESU (6-10, 1-5). Freshman Kimberly McCann had eight assists and senior Maddie Hutchison had 17 digs for the Warriors. Chelsea Hutson had six kills and 14 digs to lead Cheyney (1-12, 0-6). The Warriors travel to Kutztown for a 7 p.m. match on Tuesday night. Women's soccer IUP 2, ESU 1 INDIANA, Pa. - Erica Boyle scored the game-winning goal with 8:03 remaining as IUP posted a 2-1 win over East Stroudsburg University in PSAC women’s soccer on Saturday afternoon. Senior forward Sammi Jo Hughes scored the game-tying goal for ESU (6-3, 6-3) in the 69th minute before Boyle had the game-winner. Kiersten Zerbe gave IUP (6-4-1, 6-3-1) a 1-0 lead 3:56 into the game. ESU had a 12-9 advantage in shots, and IUP a 6-5 edge in shots on goal. Sophomore goalkeeper Jules Harris made four saves for the Warriors. Jessica Printz had four saves for IUP. Hughes’ goal was her fourth of the season and the 19th of her career, both the most among current Warriors. The Warriors posted a 5-0 win over IUP in last year’s PSAC quarterfinals. ESU is at Kutztown for a 2 p.m. start on Wednesday in a rematch of last year’s PSAC championship game won by the Warriors, 1-0, on a 78th minute goal by junior midfielder Shea Neal. By Staff reports
